channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: What's Driving the Strong Market Reaction to Trump Win
item.description: Investors believe they have a handle on what Donald Trump will do this time. But it’s not obvious that they are any better at assessing politics, or t...

item.title: ‘It strikes me as vengeful’: My friend wants to boycott a coffee shop because of the owner’s political views. Is this what America has become?
item.description: “There was a pile-on of hate and jubilance at the thought of putting this man out of business.”

item.title: Trump Win Would Have Positive Implications for Oil Sector
item.description: A Donald Trump presidency would likely have positive implications for the entire oil sector in the short term, and in particular stocks exposed to U.S...

item.title: ‘I never dreamed I’d be in this position’: I’m 69 and have $10,000 in legal bills from my divorce. Should I borrow from my IRA?
item.description: “I do not have the funds for professional advice.”

item.title: What the Trump win means for the mega-cap tech giants, according to this high-profile analyst
item.description: Shifts in the White House attitude to AI, regulation and electric vehicles may have a big impact on big tech.

item.title: Futures Surge, Bonds Tumble as Trump Is Elected President
item.description: Futures linked to all three major stock indexes climbed after Donald Trump cruised to victory in the presidential election,.

item.title: Metal Prices Slump as Trump Win Stokes Demand Fears
item.description: Metal prices slumped with the commodities sector experiencing widespread losses as Donald Trump wins the election.

item.title: ‘These friends were users and abusers’: I cut off people in my life who borrowed money. It cost me $120,000 in unpaid debts. Was I wrong?
item.description: “Of the original 10 I had earmarked for removal from my life, I’m still in contact with two.”

item.title: Trump's Comeback Reverberates Through Markets
item.description: Stock futures rose sharply along with the dollar, bond yields and bitcoin, after investors piled into “Trump trades.”

item.title: Six Flags’ revenue beats as theme-park operator says consumers flocked to its parks in October
item.description: Six Flags Entertainment Corp.’s stock rose 2.9% early Wednesday, after the theme-park operator’s third-quarter revenue beat consensus estimates and it...
